attributes.action: The British public deserves a General Election before Art. 50 is invoked
attributes.additional_details: One of the main reasons for leaving the EU was about how democratic it is. A person elected in a party conference, instead of a General Election, does not have enough legitimacy to lead the UK in the most important negotiation in a generation.
attributes.background:
A Prime Minister not elected by the British public will be in charge of the post-EU referendum negotiations. This is highly undemocratic.
A new democratically elected PM should decide, on behalf of the British people, what is best for Britain after Brexit or if the Art. 50 should be invoked at all.
